conclusion: Analyze current positions of objects and shadows to determine changes from new light source position.
Object at A is a nail or pin, casting a long, thin shadow (A) downward and slightly to the right.
Object at B is a cake on a plate, casting a rounded shadow (B) directly beneath it.
Object at C is a roll of toilet paper with a red cross, casting a cylindrical shadow (C) to its right.
Object at D is a ring, casting a small, oval shadow (D) to its right.
Current light source is positioned in front of objects, casting shadows to the right and downward.
Light source moving to 'back right' suggests repositioning diagonally behind objects in upper-right quadrant.
Shadows will shift toward front left due to light source moving to back right.
Shadow A will shift toward front left and likely elongate due to increased distance and angle.
Shadow B will move toward front left, potentially becoming larger and elongated.
Shadow C will shift toward front left, maintaining cylindrical profile but may elongate.
Shadow D will move toward front left, may increase in size and become more oval.
Height of objects affects shadow length; taller objects cast longer shadows.
Distance of light source influences shadow size; farther light source enlarges shadows.
Flat surface means no terrain effects on shadows beyond light's influence.
Summarize changes: Shadows A, B, C, and D move to front left and adjust in size.
Final answer: Shadows move to front left; A becomes longer, B larger and elongated, C elongates, D increases in size.
